title: Trump Threatens Tariffs on Key Trade Partners
description: President-elect Trump signals plans to impose a 25% tariff on all products from Mexico, China, and Canada upon taking office.

title: Inauguration Day Tariff Focus
description: During his inauguration, President Trump announces the creation of the External Revenue Service to collect tariffs and pledges to use tariffs to boost U.S. wealth.

title: 10% Tariff on All Chinese Imports
description: A 10% tariff is imposed on all Chinese imports, citing national security concerns including fentanyl trafficking.

title: Copper Tariff Evaluation Executive Order
description: President Trump signs an executive order instructing the Commerce Department to evaluate tariffs on imported copper for national security.

title: Lumber Tariff Evaluation Order
description: Executive order directs a national security review on tariffs for imported lumber and timber.

title: Major Tariffs on Canada, Mexico, and China
description: 25% tariffs are imposed on Canadian and Mexican imports (10% for Canadian energy). Chinese tariffs double to 20%.

title: Temporary Exemptions for Auto Imports
description: U.S. automakers receive temporary exemptions from new tariffs on imports from Canada and Mexico.

title: China Retaliates with Agricultural Tariffs
description: China imposes 15% tariffs on U.S. agricultural goods, including chicken, pork, soybeans, and beef.

title: Steel and Aluminum Tariffs
description: 25% tariffs go into effect on all imported steel and aluminum, removing prior exemptions.

title: Oil Tariff Linked to Venezuela Buyers
description: Executive order imposes a 25% tariff on imports from countries purchasing oil or gas from Venezuela, effective April 2.

title: Imported Cars Tariff Announced
description: 25% tariffs on almost all imported cars announced, effective April 3. Auto parts tariffs planned for May 3.

title: Baseline 10% Tariff Plan Announced
description: President Trump announces a 10% baseline tariff on most countries, with higher rates for some nations.

title: 25% Car Tariff Takes Effect
description: 25% tariffs on imported cars are implemented as scheduled.

title: 10% Tariff Policy Goes into Effect
description: The baseline 10% tariffs on most countries officially take effect.

title: Tariffs on China Rise to 104%
description: Tariffs on Chinese goods increase to 104%, including 90% tariffs on de minimis low-cost imports.

title: 90-Day Pause on Non-China Tariffs
description: The Trump administration announces a 90-day delay in implementing new tariffs on most countries, excluding China.

title: Tech Goods Tariff Refund Policy
description: A memorandum expands reciprocal tariff exemptions to tech goods and provides refunds for tariffs collected since April 5.

title: Antidumping Tariff on Mexican Tomatoes
description: The administration announces a 21% antidumping tariff on most Mexican tomato imports, effective July 14.
